intro: Tephrosia tanganicensis, commonly known as the Tanganic Tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly Tanzania. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with compound leaves and pod fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
